reasoning: SLE incidence ~5 per 100k person-years based on population-based registries. Strong epidemiological data from multiple cohorts, though significant ethnic and geographic variation (higher in African, Asian, Hispanic populations).
source: Pons-Estel GJ et al. (2010). Understanding the epidemiology and progression of systemic lupus erythematosus. Semin Arthritis Rheum. 39(4):257-268
